name: roary

variants.name: build_system
variants.description: Build systems supported by the package

description: Rapid large-scale prokaryote pan genome analysis

dependencies.name: bedtools2
dependencies.description:
Collectively, the bedtools utilities are a swiss-army knife of tools for
a wide-range of genomics analysis tasks. The most widely-used tools
enable genome arithmetic: that is, set theory on the genome.

dependencies.name: blast-plus
dependencies.description: Basic Local Alignment Search Tool.

dependencies.name: cdhit
dependencies.description:
CD-HIT is a very widely used program for clustering and comparing
protein or nucleotide sequences.

dependencies.name: fasttree
dependencies.description:
FastTree infers approximately-maximum-likelihood phylogenetic trees from
alignments of nucleotide or protein sequences.

dependencies.name: kraken
dependencies.description:
Kraken is a system for assigning taxonomic labels to short DNA
sequences, usually obtained through metagenomic studies.

dependencies.name: mafft
dependencies.description:
MAFFT is a multiple sequence alignment program for unix-like operating
systems. It offers a range of multiple alignment methods, L-INS-i
(accurate; for alignment of <~200 sequences), FFT-NS-2 (fast; for
alignment of <~30,000 sequences), etc.

dependencies.name: mcl
dependencies.description:
The MCL algorithm is short for the Markov Cluster Algorithm, a fast and
scalable unsupervised cluster algorithm for graphs (also known as
networks) based on simulation of (stochastic) flow in graphs.

dependencies.name: parallel
dependencies.description:
GNU parallel is a shell tool for executing jobs in parallel using one or
more computers. A job can be a single command or a small script that has
to be run for each of the lines in the input.

dependencies.name: perl
dependencies.description:
Perl 5 is a highly capable, feature-rich programming language with over
27 years of development.

dependencies.name: perl-array-utils
dependencies.description: Small utils for array manipulation

dependencies.name: perl-bioperl
dependencies.description:
BioPerl is the product of a community effort to produce Perl code which
is useful in biology. Examples include Sequence objects, Alignment
objects and database searching objects. These objects not only do what
they are advertised to do in the documentation, but they also interact -
Alignment objects are made from the Sequence objects, Sequence objects
have access to Annotation and SeqFeature objects and databases, Blast
objects can be converted to Alignment objects, and so on. This means
that the objects provide a coordinated and extensible framework to do
computational biology. BioPerl development focuses on Perl classes, or
code that is used to create objects representing biological entities.
There are scripts provided in the scripts/ and examples/ directories but
scripts are not the main focus of the BioPerl developers. Of course, as
the objects do most of the hard work for you, all you have to do is
combine a number of objects together sensibly to make useful scripts.
The intent of the BioPerl development effort is to make reusable tools
that aid people in creating their own sites or job-specific
applications. The BioPerl website at https://bioperl.org/ also attempts
to maintain links and archives of standalone bio-related Perl tools that
are not affiliated or related to the core BioPerl effort. Check the site
for useful code ideas and contribute your own if possible.

dependencies.name: perl-devel-overloadinfo
dependencies.description: Returns information about overloaded operators for a given class

dependencies.name: perl-digest-md5-file
dependencies.description:
Digest::MD5::File - Perl extension for getting MD5 sums for files and
urls.

dependencies.name: perl-exception-class
dependencies.description: A module that allows you to declare real exception classes in Perl

dependencies.name: perl-file-find-rule
dependencies.description:
File::Find::Rule is a friendlier interface to File::Find. It allows you
to build rules which specify the desired files and directories.

dependencies.name: perl-file-grep
dependencies.description:
File::Grep - Find matches to a pattern in a series of files and related
functions

dependencies.name: perl-file-slurper
dependencies.description: A simple, sane and efficient module to slurp a file

dependencies.name: perl-file-which
dependencies.description: Perl implementation of the which utility as an API

dependencies.name: perl-graph-readwrite
dependencies.description: Write out directed graph in Dot format

dependencies.name: perl-graph
dependencies.description: Graph data structures and algorithms

dependencies.name: perl-log-log4perl
dependencies.description: Log4j implementation for Perl

dependencies.name: perl-moose
dependencies.description: A postmodern object system for Perl 5

dependencies.name: perl-perlio-utf8-strict
dependencies.description: This module provides a fast and correct UTF-8 PerlIO layer.

dependencies.name: perl-text-csv
dependencies.description: Comma-separated values manipulator (using XS or PurePerl)

dependencies.name: perl-xml-parser
dependencies.description: XML::Parser - A perl module for parsing XML documents

dependencies.name: perl-xml-writer
dependencies.description:
XML::Writer is a helper module for Perl programs that write an XML
document. The module handles all escaping for attribute values and
character data and constructs different types of markup, such as tags,
comments, and processing instructions. By default, the module performs
several well-formedness checks to catch errors during output. This
behaviour can be extremely useful during development and debugging, but
it can be turned off for production-grade code. The module can operate
either in regular mode in or Namespace processing mode. In Namespace
mode, the module will generate Namespace Declarations itself, and will
perform additional checks on the output.

dependencies.name: prank
dependencies.description: A powerful multiple sequence alignment browser.

dependencies.name: r-ggplot2
dependencies.description:
Create Elegant Data Visualisations Using the Grammar of Graphics. A
system for 'declaratively' creating graphics, based on "The Grammar of
Graphics". You provide the data, tell 'ggplot2' how to map variables to
aesthetics, what graphical primitives to use, and it takes care of the
details.

dependencies.name: r
dependencies.description:
R is 'GNU S', a freely available language and environment for
statistical computing and graphics which provides a wide variety of
statistical and graphical techniques: linear and nonlinear modelling,
statistical tests, time series analysis, classification, clustering,
etc. Please consult the R project homepage for further information.

dependencies.name: perl-data-dumper
dependencies.description: Stringified perl data structures, suitable for both printing and eval

dependencies.name: perl-list-moreutils
dependencies.description: Provide the stuff missing in List::Util

dependencies.name: perl-svg
dependencies.description: Perl extension for generating Scalable Vector Graphics (SVG) documents.

dependencies.name: python
dependencies.description: The Python programming language.

dependencies.name: py-biopython
dependencies.description:
A distributed collaborative effort to develop Python libraries and
applications which address the needs of current and future work in
bioinformatics.

dependencies.name: py-numpy
dependencies.description: Fundamental package for array computing in Python.

dependencies.name: py-pandas
dependencies.description:
pandas is a fast, powerful, flexible and easy to use open source data
analysis and manipulation tool, built on top of the Python programming
language.

dependencies.name: py-matplotlib
dependencies.description:
Matplotlib is a comprehensive library for creating static, animated, and
interactive visualizations in Python.

dependencies.name: py-seaborn
dependencies.description:
Seaborn: statistical data visualization. Seaborn is a library for making
attractive and informative statistical graphics in Python. It is built
on top of matplotlib and tightly integrated with the PyData stack,
including support for numpy and pandas data structures and statistical
routines from scipy and statsmodels.
